intro: Stachys crispa, commonly known as woolly betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and spikes of purple to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks. Stachys crispa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
